info.title: Microsoft Cognitive Language Service - Analyze Conversations Authoring
info.description: The language service API is a suite of natural language processing (NLP) skills built with best-in-class Microsoft machine learning algorithms. The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis, key phrase extraction, language detection and question answering. Further documentation can be found in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/language-service/overview.

AADToken.description:
These are the [Azure Active Directory OAuth2](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/v1-overview) Flows. When paired with [Azure role-based access](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/role-based-access-control/overview) control it can be used to control access to Azure Maps REST APIs. Azure role-based access controls are used to designate access to one or more Azure Maps resource account or sub-resources. Any user, group, or service principal can be granted access via a  built-in role or a custom role composed of one or more permissions to Azure Maps REST APIs.

To implement scenarios, we recommend viewing [authentication concepts](https://aka.ms/amauth). In summary, this security definition provides a solution for modeling application(s) via objects capable of access control on specific APIs and scopes.

#### Notes
* This security definition **requires** the use of the `x-ms-client-id` header to indicate which Azure Maps resource the application is requesting access to. This can be acquired from the [Maps management API](https://aka.ms/amauthdetails).
* 
The `Authorization URL` is specific to the Azure public cloud instance. Sovereign clouds have unique Authorization URLs and Azure Active directory configurations. 
* 
The Azure role-based access control is configured from the [Azure management plane](https://aka.ms/amrbac) via Azure portal, PowerShell, CLI, Azure SDKs, or REST APIs.
* 
Usage of the [Azure Maps Web SDK](https://aka.ms/amaadmc) allows for configuration based setup of an application for multiple use cases.
* Currently, Azure Active Directory [v1.0 or v2.0](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/active-directory/develop/azure-ad-endpoint-comparison) supports Work, School, and Guests but does not support Personal accounts.

apim_key.description: A subscription key for a Language service resource.
apim_key.name: Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key

get.description: Gets the details of a project.

patch.description: Creates a new project or updates an existing one.

200.description: The metadata of the updated project, if it already exists.

201.description: The metadata of the created project.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

post.description: Triggers a job to export a project's data.

parameters.name: trainedModelLabel
parameters.description: Trained model label to export. If the trainedModelLabel is null, the default behavior is to export the current working copy.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

post.description: Triggers a job to import a project. If a project with the same name already exists, the data of that project is replaced.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

202.description: A successful call results with an Operation-Location header used to check the status of the job.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

Gets the status of an export job. Once job completes, returns the project metadata, and assets.

200.description: The status of the long running operation.

200.description: The details of the long running operation.

get.description: Lists the trained models belonging to a project.
Gets the details of a trained model.

post.description: Restores the snapshot of this trained model to be the current working directory of the project.

202.description: A successful call results in loading the working directory with the snapshot of the model provided.

operation-location.description: The location of the status API for monitoring the created job.

get.description: Gets the detailed results of the evaluation for a trained model. This includes the raw inference results for the data included in the evaluation process.
Gets the evaluation summary of a trained model. The summary includes high level performance measurements of the model e.g., F1, Precision, Recall, etc.
Gets the status for loading a snapshot.

200.description: The details of the long running operation.

Gets the status for a training job.

get.description: Gets the status for a project deletion job.
Lists the supported languages for the given project type.
Lists the supported prebuilt entities that can be used while creating composed entities.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The language to get supported prebuilt entities for. Required if multilingual is false. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

parameters.name: multilingual
parameters.description: Whether to get the support prebuilt entities for multilingual or monolingual projects. If true, the language parameter is ignored.

200.description: The list of supported prebuilt entities.

get.description: Lists the support training config version for a given project type.

values.description: When two or more components are found in the text and overlap, the component with the longest set of characters is returned.
All components must overlap at the exact same characters in the text for the entity to return. If one of the defined components is not matched or predicted, the entity will not return.
Every component's match or prediction is returned as a separate instance of the entity.
When two or more components are found in the text and overlap, the components' spans are merged together into one span combining all of them.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringConfusion.description: Represents a cell in a confusion matrix.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringConversat.description: Represents an entity with its components.

compositionSetting.description: The behavior to follow when the entity's components overlap with each other.

list.description: The list component of the entity.

regex.description: The regex component of the entity.

requiredComponents.description: The required components. Allowed values are 'learned', 'list', 'prebuilts' and 'regex'.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringConversat.description: Represents an exported intent of a conversational project.
Represents the exported assets of a conversational project.

intents.description: The intents defined in the project.

entities.description: The entities defined in the project.

utterances.description: The utterances defined in the project.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringConversat.description: Represents an exported utterance for a conversational project.

entities.description: Represents the entity labels of the utterance.

language.description: Represents the utterance's language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

dataset.description: The dataset for this utterance. Allowed values are 'Train' and 'Test'.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringCreateDep.description: Represents the options for creating or updating a project deployment.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringCreatePro.description: Represents the options used to create or update a project.

multilingual.description: Whether the project would be used for multiple languages or not.

language.description: The project language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringDeploymen.description: Represents the state of a deployment job.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringEntitiesE.description: Represents the evaluation result summary for the project's entities.

confusionMatrix.description: Represents the confusion matrix between two entities (the two entities can be the same). The matrix is between the entity that was labelled and the entity that was predicted.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringEntityEva.description: Represents the evaluation result for an entity.

truePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of true positive

trueNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of true negative

falsePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of false positive

falseNegativeCount.description: Represents the count of false negative

values.description: Split the data into training and test sets according to user-defined percentages.
Split the data according to the chosen dataset for every example in the data.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringEvaluatio.description: Represents the options used running the evaluation.

kind.description: Represents the evaluation kind. By default, the evaluation kind is set to percentage.

trainingSplitPercentage.description: Represents the training dataset split percentage. Only needed in case the evaluation kind is percentage.

testingSplitPercentage.description: Represents the testing dataset split percentage. Only needed in case the evaluation kind is percentage.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringEvaluatio.description: Represent a list of utterances' evaluation results.

entitiesEvaluation.description: Contains the data related to entities evaluation.

intentsEvaluation.description: Contains the data related to intents evaluation.

evaluationOptions.description: The options that were used while running the evaluation.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportPro.description: Represents the state of an export job.

resultUrl.description: The URL to use in order to download the exported project.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedC.description: Defines the orchestration details for a Conversational project target.

projectName.description: The name of the targeted project.

deploymentName.description: The name of the targeted deployment.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedC.description: Represents the orchestration options for a Conversational project target.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedE.description: Represents a list component of an entity.

sublists.description: The sub-lists of the list component.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedE.description: Represents a list of synonyms inside a list component

language.description: Represents the language of the synonyms. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedE.description: Represents a regex component of an entity.

expressions.description: The regex expressions of the regex component. These expressions follow the .NET regex syntax. For reference, check here: https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expressions

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedE.description: Represents a regex expression inside a regex component. This expression follows the .NET regex syntax. For reference, check here: https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expressions

regexKey.description: The key of the regex expression.

language.description: Represents the language of the regex expression. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedE.description: Represents a sub-list inside a list component.

synonyms.description: The phrases of that correspond to the sub-list.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedL.description: Defines the orchestration details for a LUIS application target.
Represents the orchestration options for a LUIS application target.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedO.description: Represents the options used to define the orchestration behavior of an intent.

targetProjectKind.description: The kind of the target used in the orchestration flow.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedP.description: Represents an exported prebuilt entity component

projectFileVersion.description: The version of the exported file.

stringIndexType.description: Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets. For additional information see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedP.description: Represents the assets of an exported project.

projectKind.description: The type of project containing the assets.

values.description: Specifies the format for a conversational project.
Specifies the format for an application that was exported from LUIS.

projectName.description: The name of the target project.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringExportedU.description: Represents an entity label for an utterance.

category.description: The category of the entity label.

offset.description: Start position for the entity text.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringImportPro.description: Represents the state of an import job.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringIntentEva.description: The evaluation summary for an intent.

truePositiveCount.description: Represents the count of true positive

confusionMatrix.description: Represents the confusion matrix between two intents (the two intents can be the same). The matrix is between the intent that was labelled and the intent that was predicted.

createdDateTime.description: The creation date time of the job.

lastUpdatedDateTime.description: The last date time the job was updated.

expirationDateTime.description: The expiration date time of the job.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringOrchestra.description: Represents the assets of an orchestration project.

intents.description: Represents the intents of the project.

utterances.description: Represents the utterances of the project.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringOrchestra.description: Represents an utterance of an orchestration project.

language.description: Represents the utterance's language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

dataset.description: The dataset for this utterance. Allowed values are 'Train' and 'Test'.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringPrebuiltE.description: Represents a list of the retrieved supported prebuilt entities.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringProjectDe.description: Represents the state of a project deletion job.

deploymentExpirationDate.description: Represents deployment expiration date in the runtime.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringProjectDe.description: Represents a list of retrieved deployments.

values.description: A project to build natural language into apps, bots, and IoT devices.
A project to connect and orchestrate Conversation, Custom question answering and LUIS projects together in one single project.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringProjectMe.description: Represents the metadata of a project.

lastTrainedDateTime.description: Represents the project last trained datetime.

lastDeployedDateTime.description: Represents the project last deployed datetime.

multilingual.description: Whether the project would be used for multiple languages or not.

language.description: The project language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringProjectSe.description: Represents the settings used to define the project behavior.

confidenceThreshold.description: The threshold of the intent with the highest confidence, at which the prediction will automatically be changed to "None". The value of the threshold should be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

lastTrainedDateTime.description: The last trained date time of the model.

lastTrainingDurationInSeconds.description: The duration of the model's last training request in seconds.

hasSnapshot.description: The flag to indicate if the trained model has a snapshot ready.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringProjectTr.description: Represents a list of retrieved trained models.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringProjectsM.description: Represents a list of retrieved projects' metadata.

values.description: The offset and length values will correspond to UTF-16 code units. Use this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode, for example Java, JavaScript.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringSubTraini.description: Represents the detailed state of a training sub-operation.

status.description: Represents the status of the sub-operation.

languageCode.description: The language code. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringSupported.description: Represents a list of retrieved languages.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringSwapDeplo.description: Represents the options for swapping two deployments together.

trainingConfigVersion.description: Represents the version of the config.

modelExpirationDate.description: Represents the training config version expiration date.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringTrainingC.description: Represents a list of training config versions.

value.description: The list of the training config versions.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJ.description: Represents the options for starting a new training job.

trainingConfigVersion.description: Represents training config version. By default, "latest" value is used which uses the latest released training config version.

trainingMode.description: Represents the mode of the training operation.

evaluationOptions.description: Represents the evaluation options. By default, the evaluation kind is percentage, with training split percentage as 80, and testing split percentage as 20.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJ.description: Represents the output of a training job.

trainingMode.description: Represents the mode of the training operation.

estimatedEndDateTime.description: Represents the estimated end date time for training and evaluation.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringTrainingJ.description: Represents the state of a training job.
Represents a list of retrieved training jobs.

values.description: Trains using fine-tuned neural network transformer models. Can train multilingual projects.
Faster training times for quicker iterations.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringUtterance.description: Represents the comparison between the expected and predicted entities for an utterance.
Represents the evaluation output of an entity label or prediction.

offset.description: Represents the entity offset index relative to the original text.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringUtterance.description: Represents the evaluation result for an utterance.

language.description: Represents the utterance language. This is BCP-47 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English, "en-gb" for English (UK), "es" for Spanish etc.

entitiesResult.description: Represents the entities results for the utterance.

intentsResult.description: Represents the intents results for the utterance.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringUtterance.description: Represents the comparison between the expected and the predicted intent for an utterance.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringWarning.description: Represents a warning that was encountered while executing the request.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringFormatQue.description: The format of the exported project file to use.

values.description: Specifies the format for a conversational project.
Specifies the format for an application that was exported from LUIS.
A project to build natural language into apps, bots, and IoT devices.
A project to connect and orchestrate Conversation, Custom question answering and LUIS projects together in one single project.

ConversationalAnalysisAuthoringStringInd.description: Specifies the method used to interpret string offsets. For additional information see https://aka.ms/text-analytics-offsets.

values.description: The offset and length values will correspond to UTF-16 code units. Use this option if your application is written in a language that support Unicode, for example Java, JavaScript.
